# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `mi_ha`
* Variable label: `Myocardial infarction or heart attack`
* Variable description: `Myocardial infarction or heart attack since the last wave`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | No
1        | Yes

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `mi_ha_age`
* Variable label: `Age of each episode of myocardial infarction or heart attack`
* Variable description: `Age of each episode of myocardial infarction or heart attack`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `some hedimX == 3 into 1`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `otherwise into 0`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 1, mi_ha_age = heagb`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `-1 into 996`
* `otherwise, mi_ha_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w1$id)
ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha <- rep(0,length(ELSA_w1$id))
ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha[which(ELSA_w1$hedim01==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim02==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim03==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim04==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim05==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim06==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim07==3)] <- 1
ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha[which(ELSA_w1$hedim01==-9)] <- 997
ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha[which(ELSA_w1$hedim01==-8)] <- 998

# Continuous variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w1$id))
ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha_age[which(ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha_age[which(ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha==1)] <- car::recode(ELSA_w1$heagb[which(ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha==1)],"-1=996;-8=998;-9=997")

```

#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(ELSA_ds_w1$mi_ha)
X <- c(
  sum(ELSA_w1$hedim01==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim02==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim03==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim04==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim05==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim06==3 | ELSA_w1$hedim07==3,na.rm=T),
  sum(ELSA_w1$hedim01==-9),
  sum(ELSA_w1$hedim01==-8)
)
BeforeH <- c(length(ELSA_w1$id)-sum(X),X[1:3])
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("hedimX!=3->0","hedimX==3->1","hedimX==-9->997","hedimX==-8->998")
kable(C)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `some hedimX == 3 into 1`
* `hedia01 == -9 and hedimX == -1 into 997`
* `hedia01 == -8 and hedimX == -1 into 998`
* `otherwise into 0`

To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 1, mi_ha_age = HeAgbRY - ybirth`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `-1 into 996`
* `otherwise, mi_ha_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w2$id)
ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha <- rep(0,length(ELSA_w2$id))
ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha[which(ELSA_w2$hedim01==3 | ELSA_w2$hedim02==3 | ELSA_w2$hedim03==3 | ELSA_w2$hedim04==3 | ELSA_w2$hedim05==3 | ELSA_w2$hedim06==3 | ELSA_w2$hedim07==3 | ELSA_w2$hedim08==3)] <- 1
ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha[which(ELSA_w2$hedia01==-9 & ELSA_w2$hedim01==-1)] <- 997
ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha[which(ELSA_w2$hedia01==-8 & ELSA_w2$hedim01==-1)] <- 998

# Continuous variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w2$id))
ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha_age[which(ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha_age[which(ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha==1 & !ELSA_w2$HeAgbRY %in% c(-1,-8,-9))] <- ELSA_w2$HeAgbRY[which(ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha==1 & !ELSA_w2$HeAgbRY %in% c(-1,-8,-9))] - ELSA_w2$ybirth[which(ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha==1 & !ELSA_w2$HeAgbRY %in% c(-1,-8,-9))]
ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha_age <- car::recode(ELSA_ds_w2$mi_ha_age, "-1=996;-8=998;-9=997;NA=999")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `mi_ha` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `hedimmi == 1 into 1`
* `hedimmi == -9 into 997`
* `hedimmi == -8 into 998`
* `hedimmi == 0 into 0`


To compute `mi_ha_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if mi_ha == 1, mi_ha_age = HeAgbRY - ybirth`
* `if mi_ha == 0, mi_ha_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `-1 into 996`
* `otherwise, mi_ha_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w6}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w6 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w6$id)
ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha <- car::recode(ELSA_w6$hedimmi,"-8=998;-9=997")

# Continuous variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha_age <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w6$id))
ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha_age[which(ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha==0)] <- 996
ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha_age[which(ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha==1 & !ELSA_w6$HeAgbRY %in% c(-1,-8,-9))] <- ELSA_w6$HeAgbRY[which(ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha==1 & !ELSA_w6$HeAgbRY %in% c(-1,-8,-9))] - ELSA_w6$ybirth[which(ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha==1 & !ELSA_w6$HeAgbRY %in% c(-1,-8,-9))]
ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha_age <- car::recode(ELSA_ds_w6$mi_ha_age, "-1=996;-8=998;-9=997;NA=999")

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**

```{r summ}

l.hds <- list(w1 = ELSA_ds_w1, w2 = ELSA_ds_w2, w3 = ELSA_ds_w3, w4 = ELSA_ds_w4, w5 = ELSA_ds_w5, w6 = ELSA_ds_w6, w7 = ELSA_ds_w7)

for(name in names(l.hds)) {
  aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
  label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  label(l.hds[[name]][[3]]) <- label(aux_object[[3]]) <- ds_label_age # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  l.hds[[name]][[3]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[3]], labels = cont_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  m_name <- paste0("ELSA_m_ds_",name)
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}

t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][2])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
  t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][2])[[1]][,4] 
}
t.hds[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(l.hds[[1]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[2]][[2]]) , length(l.hds[[3]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[4]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[5]][[2]]) , length(l.hds[[6]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[7]][[2]])
             )
names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label", "w1", "w2", "w3", "w4", "w5", "w6", "w7")
kable(t.hds)

dbb <- merge(ELSA_m_ds_w1[,c("id","mi_ha")], ELSA_m_ds_w2[,c("id","mi_ha")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w1",".w2"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb,ELSA_m_ds_w3[,c("id","mi_ha")], by="id", all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, ELSA_m_ds_w4[,c("id","mi_ha")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w3",".w4"), all=T)

dbb <- merge(dbb, ELSA_m_ds_w6[,c("id","mi_ha")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w5",".w6"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb,ELSA_m_ds_w7[,c("id","mi_ha")], by="id", all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w1", "w2","w4","w5")
```
